text:
Good afternoon.
 Since I was a child I wanted to be in the medical area. That's why I decided to do medicine after my high-school 's graduation. I did two years of first year in Rennes's Faculty of Medicine. During this period, I realized I was not able to learn as they want me to do. To explain, our final exam was about things, that we had to learn exactly as it was say in class. Word for word. They did not ask for logical, like mathematics for example, or physics.
 As I said before, after two years of medicine, I decided, with my mom's support of course, to do some research for change my studies and find a better school for me. To do that properly, I searched careers that can be good and pleasant for my future. Once, I'm fell on one job, which is biomedical engineer. It seems to me a very good job, it is about medical, electronic products. The most important thing was the medical is the most important part of this job. Finally, after a long period of reflection, i decided to go for it. I found a school, in Paris,  it was a perfect localization for me because I can be close to my family and my friends as well. The school's name is ESIR. One of the topics of this school was Engineer health.
 I'm writing right now on a computer of this school and I'm glad I took this decision because I'm happier, and I can approve my knowledge on medical things and at the same time I can do mathematics and physics, two topics that I love.
 To conclude this short story, my inspiration was the two years I spend in medicine school, and the love I have for the medical area.
 Thank you for reading.
Alex Dupont
